column4: Microsoft says no increase in U.S. foreign intelligence surveillance requests
column5: WASHINGTON (This version corrects story originally published on April 13 with changes in headline and paragraphs 1  2  and 4 after Microsoft issued corrected figures for U.S. surveillance requests it received in first six months of 2016. Paragraph 5 is deleted as the numbers are no longer relevant  additional paragraphs recasted to reflect new numbers with comments from Microsoft on official correction.)

column4: Tesla hikes pay to quell unrest at key German supplier
column5: PRUEM  Germany Luxury electric carmaker Tesla  offered pay rises and job guarantees to defuse labor tensions at a key German supplier  whose founder and chief executive left the company late last month  German labor officials said on Wednesday.

column4: UPDATE 2-Tesla hikes pay to quell unrest at key German supplier
column5: * Tesla says Klaus Grohmann has departed Tesla Grohmann Automation

column4: Tesla offers more sweeteners to try quell unrest at key German supplier
column5: PRUEM  Germany  April 26 Luxury electric carmaker Tesla has offered more sweeteners to try to quell unrest at a key German supplier  whose founder and chief executive has not been seen at work for weeks  German labour officials said on Wednesday.

column4: Tesla Model S loses top rating from Consumer Reports over brake issue
column5: DETROIT Tesla Inc  has lost its top safety rating from Consumer Reports  which said the electric carmaker failed to install an emergency braking feature that it promised to owners as standard equipment.

column4: BRIEF-Musk converts SolarCity senior notes into shares of Tesla common stock at conversion price of $300/shr -SEC filing
column5: * Tesla Inc CEO Musk converts SolarCity senior notes into shares of Tesla common stock at conversion price of $300 per share -SEC filing

column4: Global foundation launches value-based healthcare pilots
column5: April 26 Key healthcare stakeholders  led by the World Economic Forum  plan pilot programs this year to show the value of a new model for healthcare that would track and pay for treatment based on how well it works rather than the volume of care.
